title: Understanding SQL Syntax
text: In SQL, the SELECT statement is used to select data from a database. The data returned is stored in a result table, sometimes called the result set.

title: Components of a SELECT Statement
text: A basic SQL SELECT statement consists of the following components: SELECT, FROM, WHERE, GROUP BY, HAVING, ORDER BY.

title: Correct Syntax for SELECT
text: When selecting multiple columns, they should be separated by commas. For example: SELECT column1, column2 FROM $$table_{name}$$.

hintAnswer: Items after SELECT should be separated by commas.
title: Identifying the Error
text: Look at the query: SELECT Street ZIP FROM Customers. What is missing between 'Street' and 'ZIP'?
choices: There should only be one item after SELECT.
FROM and SELECT are in the wrong order.
Items after SELECT should be separated by commas.
Items after SELECT should be enclosed in parentheses.
